dcterms:creator: A. D. Singh
S. S. Sandha
L. Garcia
M. Srivastava
dcterms:description: The MMActivity Dataset is an indoor human activity dataset consisting of 5 activities, including walking, jumping, jumping jacks, squats, and boxing. Each activity is performed by two subjects in front of the radar, which is placed on a tripod at a height of 1.3m in a laboratory environment. The radar chip is capable of detecting moving objects in the 3D plane and producing point clouds with multi-dimensional information.
dcterms:title: MMActivity

dcterms:description: The discHAR dataset collects each independent individual activity without considering the transition between two events. It is designed to capture discrete human activities.
dcterms:title: discHAR

dcterms:description: The contHAR dataset collects continuous events that are closer to real-world scenarios, capturing both activity frames and the transition frames between two activities.
dcterms:title: contHAR
